## Description

Briefly describe what this PR does.

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test coverage improvement

## Changes Made

- List specific changes made
- Include relevant file paths
- Explain any architectural decisions

## Testing Performed

- [ ] All existing tests pass (`uv run poe test`)
- [ ] Added new tests for new functionality
- [ ] Tested manually with sample GEDCOM file
- [ ] Tested with large GEDCOM file (if performance-related)

## Code Quality

- [ ] Linting passes (`uv run poe lint`)
- [ ] Formatting passes (`uv run ruff format --check .`)
- [ ] Type checking passes (`uv run poe typecheck`)
- [ ] Pre-commit hooks pass
- [ ] No new warnings introduced

## Documentation

- [ ] Updated README.md (if user-facing change)
- [ ] Updated API.md (if tool/resource changed)
- [ ] Updated CHANGELOG.md under [Unreleased]
- [ ] Added docstrings to new functions
- [ ] Updated TROUBLESHOOTING.md (if common issue addressed)

## Checklist

- [ ] Code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Complex code has explanatory comments
- [ ] No commented-out code or debug prints
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive

## Related Issues

Closes #(issue number)

Any additional information that reviewers should know.

## Breaking Changes

If this is a breaking change, describe:
1. What breaks
2. How users should migrate
3. Why the breaking change is necessary
